meanings.definition: The quality or state of being significant.
meanings.sent1: The significancies of his actions were clear to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She pondered the significancies of the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics added a touch of significancies to the dull afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The significancies of her words echoed in his mind long after she had left.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the significancies of honesty in all aspects of life.

meanings.definition: The meaning or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the significancies of the experiment was crucial for its success.
meanings.sent2: The significancies of his role in the project became clearer as time passed.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gift held great significancies for the young girl.
meanings.sent4: The significancies of friendship can never be underestimated.
meanings.sent5: The significancies of her smile brightened up his day.
